metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12204 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Improper memory initialization in Platform Sample/Silicon Referencefirmware Intel(R) Server Board, Intel(R) Server System and Intel(R) ComputeModule may allow privileged user to potentially enable an escalation ofprivilege via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12204` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20190514.0ubuntu0.14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20190514.0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
